We came here to celebrate my mother‚Äôs birthday, and unfortunately the entire experience was disappointing and unprofessional. I had made a reservation in advance and specifically noted it was for a birthday celebration. I even reconfirmed with the host during the meal that someone would be bringing out a dessert for my mom.
Our server, Bryan, never once checked on us during the night. He seemed completely unaware of what was happening at our table and, frankly, gave the impression that he had no clue what was going on at all. The only thing he did quickly was bring the check at the end of the night, telling us to have a good evening ‚Äî without any mention of the birthday.
I went back up to the host (a woman working behind the bar, clearly overwhelmed), and explained the situation. Bryan came over asking what I needed, and when I told him, he admitted no one had told him about the birthday. He went to the host to ask, and instead of handling it professionally, she literally turned to me from across the room, shrugged her shoulders, and shouted, ‚ÄúI forgot.‚Äù
This was supposed to be a special night and a surprise for my mother, who I rarely get to see since we don‚Äôt live in the same state. Instead, it felt careless and dismissive. Between a server who was inattentive and a host who openly admitted to ‚Äúforgetting‚Äù in front of the whole room, the evening was ruined. I would not recommend this restaurant for any special occasion.

Great food, service and atmosphere. Reasonably priced, great cocktails. It was a busy Saturday night and they were super kind and worked to find a table for us. Waiter was great and attentive. We shared 3 entrees and an appetizer. Perfect amount of food for a family of 5. We were full at the end, I wish I wasn‚Äôt, because their desert menu looked good, especially the cocktails. What a cute place. Books & Booze theme.  We came here because the hubs was looking for a dive bar he used to frequent. Bar still exists, but not so much a dive anymore. I had the Southern Waffle Brunch Plate and it did not disappoint, Lord, Two Pork Short Ribs, Three Chicken Wings, Two Waffles drizzled w/Hot Honey & I choose side salad, I could not finish it all. The meats and waffles were fabulous! Sorry but I am not a take pictures of my plate kind of girl, so I dug in before I took a Pic, but once I tasted everything I knew I had to. This restaurant is located where the old Beso used to be. But they changed decor so much and it looks good. The food was good. Service was good. Nothing really jumped out at me but I think maybe because it was busy. We‚Äôll have to come again.

We loved the atmosphere. Very lovely books of inclusion displayed prominently on the walls. It makes you feel very welcoming. We had the tacos that were very flavorful as an appetizer. Definitely recommend! The chicken and waffles with fried ribs were just 2.5/5. The waffles were hot but the combination of hot honey drizzled over the waffle, chicken and ribs did not do anything for me. The burger was medium rare beautifully plated just came up short on the flavor and a tad dry 2.5/5. The biggest pet peeve of mine is not making sure the customer understands that you are charging per glass of soda. Don‚Äôt play word games. I had to ask if we were being charged per glass. Be transparent on the beverages‚Ä¶I will take it out your tip.

The room is really cool, I like the design a lot. The scallops francese were fine. Duck spring rolls were way too overstuffed with meat. It made the bite too heavy.

Shrimp carbonara was an odd profile. Not very reminiscent of a carbonara, more cajun. The short rib dish was really good, a tad over-salted.

I wouldn‚Äôt order any of these dishes again frankly. Might consider a second meal here but I doubt it.

he Basement is a true hidden gem near the Staten Island Ferry! The atmosphere is perfect for a romantic and laid-back date night, while the bar area offers a lively, social vibe. The service was outstanding; our server went above and beyond, making us feel so welcome even with our 9-month-old in tow. And the food? Absolutely mouthwatering‚Äîdon‚Äôt just take my word for it, check out the pics! If you‚Äôre taking the ferry, you have to stop by and experience it for yourself!

Restaurant is extremely cozy and aesthetically pleasing, perfect for a date night or some family quality time! Our waitress, Paula I believe, was friendly, sweet and kind! The food, however, was quite a miss for us. The wings came with three drums and one flat, which was uneven but an easy fix according to our waitress. The carbonara had nice flavors, but the bacon was over-charred and was extremely salty, which detracted from the dish's overall enjoyment. My favorite of the dish was the shrimp, which was cooked PERFECTLY and had a nice bouncy texture! The bolognese was also overly salty as well, which was worse than the carbonara because it was the entire dish, whereas the carbonara was just the bacon bits (though the bacon was quite vital to the dish). The French onion soup didn't really char the cheese as evident in the photo, which resulted in goopy cheese instead of a nice crisp one.

Overall, the Basement has a lot of promise and there's still so much on the menu that I would love to try! Unfortunately this time it was a miss for us, but I would love to come back again someday to give the Basement the 5 stars I know they are capable of!

Thank you for reading and best of luck! (:
